section.name: Design file
section.p: The design file is the main element of the pipeline. It contains all informations and descriptions of the experiment. It is a simple tabuled plain text file inspired by limma design file. Usualy the design file is named design.txt. Here is a sample of design file:
section.source: SampleNumber Name Reads Genome Annotation FastqFormat Condition RepTechGroup Experiment 1 s1 s1.fq mouse_build37.fasta mouse_build37.gff fastq-illumina c1 repT1 project1 2 s2 s2.fq mouse_build37.fasta mouse_build37.gff fastq-illumina c2 repT2 project1 3 s3 s3.fq mouse_build37.fasta mouse_build37.gff fastq-illumina c1 repT3 project1 4 s4 s4.fq mouse_build37.fasta mouse_build37.gff fastq-illumina c2 repT3 project1
section.p: In a design file 3 fields are mandatory:

ul.li: SampleNumber: Numeric, must be unique and >0
Name: Name of the sample. Must be unique
Reads: Path to the reads data file. For backward compatibility with Eoulsan 1.0.x, this field can also be named FileName.

section.p: User can add any additional field in this file. Some of the optional field are currently used in Eoulsan:

ul.li: Genome: Path to genome file in fasta format
Annotation: Path to annotation file of the genome in GFF3 format
Condition: Condition for the sample in the experiment

FastqFormat: Fastq format. Currently Eoulsan 4 formats: fastq-sanger (default), fastq-solexa, fastq-illumina and fastq-illumina-1.5. See Cock et al for more information about the various fastq formats.
RepTechGroup: Technical replicates group. Use to pool reads counts between technical replicates in differential analysis step.
Experiment: The name of the project. Use to name plots.
UUID: Universal Unique Identifier of the sample. This field is generated by Eouslan createdesign command. In obfuscated design files, this value does not change.

section.p: All paths in the design file can be URL and compressed files in gzip (.gz) or bzip2 (.bz2) are handled by Eoulsan.
Note: For some fields like genome or annotation, only one unique value is allowed for all the samples of the design file.

subsection.name: Paired-end support
subsection.p: Paired-end files of a sample can be set between bracket and must be separated by a coma. The following design file show a example of design file with paired-end files:
subsection.source: SampleNumber Name Reads Genome Annotation FastqFormat Condition ReplicateType UUID 1 s1 [s1a.fq.bz2,s1b.fq.bz2] genome.fasta annotation_only.gff fastq-sanger s1 B 705d190c-de47-4c4f-8ddf-881c9b89ca66 2 s2 [s2a.fq.bz2,s2b.fq.bz2] genome.fasta annotation_only.gff fastq-sanger s2 B 54c8833f-77e1-4e4f-90c2-742e459df7a7
subsection.p: Warning : This feature in experimental in Eoulsan 1.1. Only the filterreads and some mappers in mapreads steps in local mode can handle paired-end files.

subsection.name: Repository for genomes and annotation
subsection.p: To avoid duplication of genome and annotation files, Eoulsan can access to repositories dedicated to for this types of data. To access to this repositories, Eoulsan support two protocols : genome and annotation. See the data repository to see how define repositories. Here are few example of design file using genome and annotation protocols:
subsection.source: SampleNumber Name Reads Genome Annotation FastqFormat Condition RepTechGroup Experiment 1 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT1 projectX 12 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT1 projectX 3 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT2 projectX 54 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT2 projectX 15 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT3 projectX 5 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT4 projectX 25 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT3 projectX 13 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT3 projectX

subsection.name: Technical replicates handling
subsection.p: To handle replicates, the RepTechGroup fieldhave been add to the design file. Here is an example of a design file using RepTechGroup field:
subsection.source: SampleNumber Name Reads Genome Annotation FastqFormat Condition RepTechGroup Experiment 1 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT1 projectX 12 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT1 projectX 3 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT2 projectX 54 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 repT2 projectX 15 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 na projectX 5 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 NA projectX 25 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT3 projectX 13 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 repT3 projectX
subsection.p: In this example below there is three technical replicates groups. For all sample with the same RepTechGroup value, reads counts are pooled. Sample with na, NA, Na or nA value aren't pooled.
For experiments without technicals replicates, all RepTechGroup fields must have a na value. Here is an example:
subsection.source: SampleNumber Name Reads Genome Annotation FastqFormat Condition RepTechGroup Experiment 1 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 na projectX 12 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 Na projectX 3 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 na projectX 54 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c1 NA projectX 15 s1 s1.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 na projectX 5 s2 s2.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 NA projectX 25 s3 s3.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 na projectX 13 s4 s4.fq genome://mouse annotation://mouse fastq-illumina c2 NA projectX
